results.title: One hand clapping
results.creator_credit: Joan Henson, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Noise pollution is a scourge of our time no less than are the visible forms that contaminate our environment. From the jangle of the alarm clock to the din of downtown, noise assails us throughout the day. The way the film depicts this aural enemy provides overpowering, at times amusing, evidence that here, too, the time has come to call a halt. Cast includes Ghislaine Phaneuf, Don Scanlan, Griffith Brewer, Dave Broadfoot, Sonny Cullen, Don Arioli, Judith Gault.

results.title: One flew over the cuckoo's nest [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Milos Forman, Michael Douglas, Saul Zaentz and Fantasy Films
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Ken Kesey, this wry film stars Jack Nicholson as an inmate feigning insanity in an asylum. Nurse Ratchitt (Louise Fletcher) a woman whose cool, controlled demeanour masks her own form of insanity in the execution of iron-fisted control over her domain and all who come under her care. The story is an allegory of an era. While the people may seem crazy, it is the system which defines craziness, and by doing so, it is the system which has problems; not those who suffer under it. Few other films have made such a strong impression on repeated generations of filmgoers, and few films will ever match the power and integrity of this masterpiece. Winner of four 1975 Academy Awards: Best Director, Actor, Actress and Adapted screenplay.

results.title: One designer, two designer
results.creator_credit: Alexander Stitt, Phillip Adams and Industrial Design Council of Australia
results.brief_description: This animated short film comically explores the importance of good design and the pitfalls of impractical design. It discusses the function of designers and designs, emphasising the need for the consumer to be more critical and thoroughly check each product before purchasing and the value of looking past attractive advertising slogans.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alexander Stitt, Phillip Adams and Industrial Design Council of Australia

results.title: Max's money troubles
results.creator_credit: Chris Adshead, Timothy Read, Australia. Department of the Attorney-General and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A humorous dramatisation about the implications of declaring oneself bankrupt. Max is an ordinary family man, who is in deep financial difficulty. His debts far exceed his ability to pay. We follow Max through the steps he must take to solve his seemingly unsolvable problem. He appears to find an ideal expedient in declaring himself bankrupt, but through counselling Max learns of the likely consequences of this and that it should only ever be a last resort. Written by Donald Crombie.

results.title: Mauvais Sang = Bad Blood
results.creator_credit: Leos Carax, Alain Dahan and Philippe Diaz
results.brief_description:
Alex’s father, an old ganster, has just died. For old time’s sake, Alex asks two former accomplices of his father to organise one last robbery. The target is a new antidote designed to fight a virus called STBO. STBO is spread by having impersonal sex and is killing adolescents by the score. With ‘Mauvais Sang’ (his second film), Leos Carax finds his way into an esthetic movement of French cinema emerging in the 1980’s as ‘neo-baroque’ (aka ‘cinema du look’). Just like Luc Besson and Jean-Jacques Beineix, Carax favours outrageous lighting effects, a very pronounced acting style and a fetishist usage of objects. Awards: Prix Louis Delluc, 1986.

Credits: Producers, Alain Dahan, Philippe Diaz ; director, Leos Carax ; writer, Leos Carax ; photography, Jean-Yves Escoffier ; music, Charlie Chaplin, Sergei Prokofiev, Benjamin Britten.
Cast: Denis Lavant, Juliette Binoche, Michel Piccoli, Hans Meyer, Julie Delpy, Hugo Pratt, Serge Reggiani, Mireille Perrier, Jerome Zucca.

results.title: Maud Lewis: a world without shadows
results.creator_credit: Diane Beaudry, Kathleen Shannon and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Against a backdrop of charming paintings and the Yarmouth, Nova Scotia, landscape they reflect, Maud Lewis: A World Without Shadows celebrates the life and work of one of Canada’s foremost primitive painters. Emerging from her youth crippled with arthritis, Maud Lewis escaped into her painting at the age of thirty. She had never seen a work of art and had never attended an art class but her paintings captured the simple strength, beauty and happiness of the world she saw - a world without shadows.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Diane Beaudry, Kathleen Shannon and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Matrioska
results.creator_credit: Co Hoedeman, Dorothy Courtois, Joseph Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This is a dance of Russian dolls, as lively in its way as any performance of the Moiseyev Company. But these are painted wooden dolls, hollow inside and of graded sizes so that the largest holds all the rest. What the animator does with them makes for a charming film fantasy. They twirl, swing and sway to gay Russian tunes, never losing their fixed reserve. As the dance ends they hop up in turn into the mother figure, who then hurries off the scene. (Award: New York)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Co Hoedeman, Dorothy Courtois, Joseph Koenig and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: One in five
results.creator_credit: Peter Griffiths, David Evans and Millbank Films
results.brief_description: One in five people is likely to have a heart attack. We look at five people - a business executive, a roadworker, a switchboard operator, computer programmer and an electrician; and see why each one may be a candidate for a heart attack. Ways of preventing the risk of heart disease are discussed.

A cautionary tale about sibling love, rivalry and loyalty and a dare that turned 7 year old Tessa’s life upside down.
